intro: Chamaesyce sebastinei, commonly known as the Seychelles sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Seychelles Islands. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the wet season. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Chamaesyce sebastinei is often found in coastal dunes and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
